item.title: Where could Scotland site a new national park?
item.description: An SNP-Green deal has cleared the way for the creation of the first new national park in nearly 20 years.

item.title: Scotland's prostitution laws 'outdated and unjust'
item.description: A pledged new "model for Scotland" would seek to tackle men's demand for purchasing sex and keep women safe.

item.title: Scotland's papers: surge in virtual GP visits and care 'poll tax'
item.description: The fall in face-to-face GP appointments and the prospect of a National Insurance hike make the front pages.

item.title: 'I've raised £100,000 after 24 years of coffee mornings'
item.description: Eleanor Moffat has spent more than 20 years organising charity events after her sister was diagnosed with cancer.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Opposition increasing towards vaccine passports
item.description: Resistance is building from different sectors to proposals for vaccine certification to be shown in selected settings.

item.title: The Gathering: Music festival draws large crowd
item.description: About 6,000 people attended one-day event in Inverness, one of the largest since the relaxation of Covid rules.

item.title: Glasgow company fined £150,000 for making nuisance calls
item.description: Glasgow-based DialADeal Scotland Ltd made more than half a million unsolicited calls between August 2019 and March 2020.

item.title: Major search launched in Ballachulish for missing man
item.description: Coastguard and mountain rescue teams have joined police in the search for Bathgate man Patryck Lipinski in Ballachulish.

item.title: Man dies after motorbike in crash with car in Annan
item.description: The collision happened on the B6357 Annan to Jedburgh Road at lunchtime on Saturday.

item.title: Police name woman who died in Arthur's Seat fall in Edinburgh
item.description: A man is charged after Fawziyah Javed, 31, died following a cliff fall in Edinburgh on Thursday evening.

item.title: Bike crashes through driver's windscreen on M9 at West Lothian
item.description: The driver of a Ford Focus had a lucky escape after the bike broke free from another car as she drove through West Lothian.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What do we know about the vaccine passport?
item.description: A new vaccine passport scheme is planned for Scotland, but it is still unclear where it will be needed.

item.title: Why vaccinating all teens is a difficult decision
item.description: Concerns over a very rare heart side-effect are giving vaccine experts pause for thought.

item.title: Covid: How will Scotland's vaccine certificate change?
item.description: Scotland is launching a QR code system in line with similar "passports" rolled out across Europe.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: When do school pupils have to self-isolate?
item.description: With the virus surging, we re-examine the new isolation rules and ask whether schools can ask pupils to stay at home.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Is the drive to get young people jabbed working?
item.description: Covid cases are rising sharply in young adults despite all over 16s being eligible for vaccination.

item.title: Covid jab response low for some immunosuppressed people
item.description: Some high risk patients had few or no infection-fighting antibodies in their blood, a vaccine study found.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: It was a dark time - now I want to revive granny's legacy
item.description: Barrie Henderson was devastated when his family restaurant closed, but now plans to bring back the family name.

item.title: Pride march returns to Glasgow after Covid pause
item.description: Participants, dressed in bright colours, were asked to take a lateral flow test before the event and wear masks.

item.title: 'I've eaten the same breakfast for the last 22 years'
item.description: A veteran hotel inspector reveals the highs and lows of working undercover in Scotland.

item.title: 'I'm living my childhood dream as a theme park designer'
item.description: Bitten by the funfair bug when just three in Aberdeen, Iona Jost now works in America designing attractions.

item.title: Great-gran raises £100,000 for charity over 24 years
item.description: Eleanor Moffat has reached her fundraising target after countless coffee mornings and other events in Coldstream and beyond.

item.title: Anas Sarwar: Vaccine passports may 'entrench vaccine hesitancy'
item.description: Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar fears vaccine passports may deter people from getting the coronavirus jab.

item.title: Glasgow Pride Mardi Gla march returns
item.description: Pride celebrations have returned to Glasgow following its cancellation last year due to Covid.

item.title: Have you ever heard of alpaca therapy?
item.description: At a farm in Fife, a herd of the South American animals are being used to help people with varying disabilities and mental health issues.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon 'so deeply offended' by Conservative MSP's comment
item.description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon complains after a Scottish Conservative MSP suggests she is anti-English.

item.title: Austria v Scotland: Fraser, McLean & Patterson out for Scots, Paul McGinn in
item.description: Ryan Fraser, Kenny McLean and Nathan Patterson are out of Scotland's World Cup qualifier against Austria, with Paul McGinn called up.

item.title: Scottish Gossip: Scotland, Austria, Gauld, Rangers, Dundee United, St Johnstone
item.description: Scotland players carrying knocks to be assessed before Tuesday's match in Austria.

item.title: Solheim Cup 2021: Europe hold off United States fight back to take 9-7 lead into Monday's singles matches
item.description: Europe hold off a United States fight back to take a 9-7 lead into Monday's Solheim Cup singles matches in Ohio.

item.title: Scotland 1-0 Moldova: Is poor finishing a threat to Scots' World Cup hopes?
item.description: BBC Scotland dissects how Steve Clarke's Scotland have become one of the worst finishers in European football.

item.title: SWPL: Glasgow City off to flyer in defence of title as Celtic, Hibs and Hamilton Accies also win
item.description: Glasgow City make a winning start to the defence of the Scottish title with a 6-0 thrashing of Motherwell as Celtic, Hibernian and Hamilton Academical also win.
